result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:30 PM Defendant Keon Steffon Simmons in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $250 cash bond with conditions: No contact with Co Defendant Amari Travis. No contact with Woodmans or Festival Foods in Rock County.  Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Preliminary Hearing requested by zoom. Preliminary Hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 11:30 AM.
